headline: Carrot-Zucchini Cake
description: Using both carrot and zucchini gives this tasty 3-layer cake covered in walnut cream cheese frosting extra moisture and a unique flavor.
name: Carrot-Zucchini Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour three 8-inch round cake pans.
Mix sugar, all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, cinnamon, salt, and baking soda in a bowl.

Combine oil, eggs, carrots, and zucchini in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer on low speed until well blended. Beat in honey. Stir in sugar mixture gradually; beat on medium speed until batter is smooth, about 3 minutes.
Divide batter evenly among prepared cake pans.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Cool in the pans for 5 minutes. Invert onto a wire rack; allow to cool completely, about 25 minutes.
Combine confectioners' sugar, pineapple, cream cheese, walnuts, butter, and vanilla extract in a large bowl; beat until frosting is smooth. Spread over cooled cakes and stack.

review.reviewBody: Only wanted a smaller cake so halved the recipe and baked in one 20cm pan. The resulting cake was superb! Lovely moist texture and the cream cheese frosting was....well...."the icing on the cake"ðŸ™‚ Thank you for sharing this recipe - We all reckon it is a beauty!
I haven't made this yet but have saved it so I can make it. It looks and sounds delicious.

I was unable to post a picture due to the size however this recipe turned out amazing! I didnt have whole wheat flour but it still worked out perfectly! I also added walnuts at the top prior to popping in the oven. This is a MUST SHARE recipe !!

I loved this cake! I made just a few small changes in the recipe to make it healthier. Instead of 1 1/2 cups of oil, I used 3/4 cups coconut oil and 3/4 cups applesauce. I added about 1/2 cup of pecans as well. I baked this in a 9 x 13 pan and halved the icing recipe. I felt the icing was a bit too sweet and would increase the cream cheese and add less sugar next time. This was a real hit tonight with a group of friends and I'll definitely make it again.
